## Task 0

These are some examples for checking Armstrong numbers. 
Please remove this portion in your final submission.

```{r starter-examples, results='hold'}
1 ^ 1 == 1
5 ^ 1 == 5
2 ^ 2 + 6 ^ 2 == 26
1 ^ 3 + 5 ^ 3 + 3 ^ 3 == 153
2 ^ 3 + 1 ^ 3 + 0 ^ 3 == 210
```

## Task 1

```{r}
is.armstrong <- function(x, na.rm=FALSE) {
  if (is.na(x)){
    na.rm <- TRUE
  }
  if (typeof(x) != "double") {
    return(FALSE)
  }
  xstr <- as.character(x) ## convert integers to characters so we know how many digits the numbers have
  lengthx <- length(split(xstr,"")) ## number of digits
  sumofs <- 0
  for (i in lengthx) { ## calculate the sum of squares of the digits
    sumofs <- sumofs + as.numeric(xstr[i])^lengthx
    i = i + 1
  }
  if (sumofs==x){
    return(TRUE)
  }
  else return(FALSE)
}
```

#### Valid inputs

```{r valid-inputs}

is.armstrong(x = 153)
is.armstrong(x = 154)
is.armstrong(x = c(153, 154, NA))
is.armstrong(x = c(1, 33, 999))
```

#### Invalid inputs

```{r eval=FALSE, error=TRUE}
is.armstrong(x = -2)
is.armstrong(x = 1011)
is.armstrong(x = c(pi, 6))
is.armstrong(x = "a")
```
